messages.message:
Hi, just on the phone with a customer right now, I can see from their screen we aren’t handing scrollbars correctly when on Windows in AI Hub, we have some which are overridden with the Pollen them (in the Doc Widget) but some which aren’t and then some excess ones around the outside of the window that shouldn’t be there.

Can we override the design of them all so they are consistent and remove the excess scrollbars? Windows is pretty annoying with scrollbars all over the place.
We can also see the type of screen resolutions people use, which makes things look a bit cramped particularly with the chat box model options.
@Paul H @Arjun you might be able to triage this?
@alagu fyi our customers often use much smaller screens than what we design for
We can have a look at Google analytics to get an understanding of resolutions that users use.
We’ll take a look in AIHub Build — the screenshot is showing AIHub Converse so I’ll let the converse team handle that part.
